alert.note: Alert for Charles City; Eastern King and Queen; Gloucester; Isle of Wight; James City; Newport News; Southampton; Suffolk; Surry; Sussex; York (Virginia) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Wakefield (Eastern Virginia and Southern Maryland)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued July 24 at 4:59AM EDT by NWS Wakefield
info.description: ...Thunderstorms with heavy rain will impact portions of northeastern Northampton, northwestern Hertford, Isle of Wight, Southampton, York, east central Sussex, James City, central Gloucester, southeastern Charles City, and Surry Counties, the northern City of Newport News, the City of Franklin, the southwestern City of Suffolk and the City of Williamsburg through 600 AM EDT... At 458 AM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking thunderstorms centered along a line extending from College Of William And Mary to near Isle Of Wight to near Como. Movement was northeast at 15 mph. HAZARD...Heavy rain. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Reduced visibility and minor flooding of poor drainage and low lying areas. Locations impacted include... Newport News, Williamsburg, Franklin, Smithfield, Gloucester Courthouse, Murfreesboro, Windsor, Courtland, Wakefield, Claremont, Surry, Queens Lake, Norge, Gloucester Point, Virginia Institute For Marine Sciences, Toano, College Of William And Mary, Holland, Suffolk and Isle Of Wight. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...<30 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Be prepared for rapid changes in weather and road conditions. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways.

area.areaDesc: Charles City; Eastern King and Queen; Gloucester; Isle of Wight; James City; Newport News; Southampton; Suffolk; Surry; Sussex; York
